gurmukhi: ਜੰਗ ਮੁਸਾਫਾ ਬੱਜਿਅਾ; ਰਣਿ ਘੁਰੇ ਨਗਾਰੇ ਚਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Jan Mousaapha Bajjiaa Ran Ghure Nagdare Chaavale||
translation: The war-trumpet sounded and the enthusiastic drums thundered in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਝੂਲਨਿ ਨੇਜੇ ਬੈਰਕਾ; ਨੀਸਾਣ ਲਸਨਿ ਲਸਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Jhoolan Neje Bairakaa Neesaan Lasan(i) Lisaavale||
translation: The lances swung and the lustrous tassels of the banners glistened.

gurmukhi: ਢੋਲ ਨਗਾਰੇ ਪੳੁਣ ਦੇ; ੳੂਂਘਨ ਜਾਣ ਜਟਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Dhol Nagdare Paoun De Oonghan Jaan Jataavale||
translation: The drums and trumpets echoed and the worriors were dozing like the drunkard with matted hair.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰਗਾ ਦਾਨੋ ਡਹੇ; ਰਣਿ ਨਾਦ ਵੱਜਨ ਖੇਤ ਭੀਹਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Durgad Daano Dahe Ran Naad Vajjan Khet(u) Bheehaavale||
translation: Durga and demons waged war in the battlefield where dreadful music is being played.

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰ ਪਰੋਤੇ ਬਰਛੀੲੇ; ਜਣ ਡਾਲ ਚਮੁੱਟੇ ਅਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Beer Darote Barchheeen Jan Daal Chamoutte Aavale||
translation: The brave fighters were pierced by daggers like the phylianthus emblica sticking with the bough.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਵੱਢੇ ਤੇਗੀ ਤੜਫੀਅਨ; ਮਦ ਪੀਤੇ ਲੋਟਨਿ ਬਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Ik Vaddhe Tegitadpheean Mad Peete Lotan(i) Baavale||
translation: Some writhe being chopped by the sword like the rolling mad drunkards.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਚੁਣ ਚੁਣ ਝਾੜੳੁ ਕਢੀਅਨ; ਰੇਤ ਵਿਚੌ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਡਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Ik Choun Choun Jhaadau Kadheean Ret Vichon Suinaa Daavale||
translation: Some are picked up from the bushes like the process of panning out gold from the sand.

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾ ਤਿ੍ਰਸੂਲਾਂ ਬਰਛੀਅਾਂ; ਤੀਰ ਵੱਗਨ ਖਰੇ ੳੁਤਾਵਲੇ ||
transliteration: Gadaa Trisoolaan Barchheeaan Teer Vaggad Kdare Outaavale||
translation: The maces, tridents, daggers and arrows are being struck with real hurry.

gurmukhi: ਜਣ ਡਸੇ ਭੁਜੰਗਮ ਸਾਵਲੇ; || ਮਰ ਜਾਵਨ ਬੀਰ ਰੁਹਾਵਲੇ ||੮||
transliteration: Jan Dase Bhujanad Saavale|| Mar Jaavan Beer Ruhaavale||8||
translation: It appears that black snakes are stinging and the furious heroes are dying.8.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖਣ ਚੰਡ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ਨੂੰ; ਰਣ ਘੁਰੇ ਨਗਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Dekhan Channd Prachanndd Noon Ran Ghure Nagdare||
translation: Seeing the intense glory of Chandi, the trumpets souded in the battlefield.
The highly furious demons ran on all four sides.

gurmukhi: ਹੱਥੀ ਤੇਗਾਂ ਪਕੜਿ ਕੈ; ਰਣ ਭਿੜੇ ਕਰਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Hattheen Tegadn Pakad(i) Kai Ran Bhide Kardare||
translation: Holding their swords in their hands they fought very bravely in the battlefield.
